Huge! Russia to ban log exports.Yahoo often does not allow me to post website inks . You can find the story on woodbusiness.ca *just type Russia log exports ban). The ban won't occur until next year, but it speaks volumes. Contrary to those that think "there are plenty of trees" it is in fact not true. Yes, there is an exception in that the U.S. southeast does in fact have excess trees and so I would expect more lumber mills to built there over time. But when we think the huge expanse of Russia feels the need to limit log exports has to speak volumes. Expect more sales and higher prices for U.S. trees.
